BITD.Warning: Be aware, this will clear all Heat/Wanted
BITD.CrewTypeBox: Click to choose a Crew Type
BITD.ChooseOneOrTwoEdges: Choose one or two edges and an equal number of flaws
BITD.AddAdditionalTypeOfGangText:
You can add an additional type to a gang or expert by spending two crew upgrades.
When a cohort performs actions for which its types apply, it uses its full quality rating. Otherwise, its quality is zero. A given cohort can have up to two types. Some crew upgrades will add the “Elite” feature to a gang, which gives them +1d when they roll for a given Type.
BITD.ClassExpClue1: Every time you roll a desperate action, mark Karma in that action's attribute.
BITD.ClassExpClue2: You expressed your beliefs, drives, heritage, or background.
BITD.ClassExpClue3: You struggled with issues from your vice or traumas during the session.
BITD.ClassExpClueDescription: At the end of each session, for each item below, mark 1 Karma (in your playbook or an attribute) or 2 Karma if that item occurred multiple times.
BITD.CrewExpClue1: At the end of each session, for each item below, mark 1 Karma (or instead mark 2 Karma if that item occurred multiple times).
BITD.GangTypeRoversDescription: Sailors, carriage drivers, and deathlands scavengers.
BITD.EdgesFearsomeDescription: The cohort is terrifying in aspect and reputation.
BITD.EdgesIndependentDescription: The cohort can be trusted to make good decisions and act on their own initiative in the absence of direct orders.
BITD.EdgesLoyalDescription: The cohort can't be bribed or turned against you.
BITD.EdgesTenaciousDescription: The cohort won't be deterred from a task.
BITD.FlawsPrincipledDescription: The cohort has an ethic or values that it won't betray.
BITD.FlawsSavageDescription: The cohort is excessively violent and cruel.
BITD.FlawsUnreliableDescription: The cohort isn't always available, due to other obligations, stupefaction from their vices, etc.
BITD.FlawsWildDescription: The cohort is drunken, debauched, and loud-mouthed.
BITD.HarmImpairedDescription: The cohort operates with reduced quality (-1d).
BITD.HarmBrokenDescription: The cohort can't do anything until they recover.
BITD.HarmDeadDescription: The cohort is destroyed. You can spend coin equal to your Tier +2 to restore it, plus two downtime activities to recruit new gang members, or hire a new expert.
BITD.RollTokenDescription: If you want to pull the numbers from a character, select their Token first.
BITD.RollPartialSuccessPositionControlle: You hesitate. Withdraw and try a different approach, or else do it with a minor consequence: a minor complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you suffer lesser harm, you end up in a risky position.
BITD.RollPartialSuccessPositionRisky: You do it, but there's a consequence: you suffer harm, a complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you end up in a desperate position.
BITD.RollPartialSuccessPosition: You do it, but there's a consequence: you suffer severe harm, a serious complication occurs, you have reduced effect.
BITD.RollFailurePositionControlled: You falter. Press on by seizing a risky opportunity, or withdraw and try a different approach.
BITD.RollFailurePositionRisky: Things go badly. You suffer harm, a complication occurs, you end up in a desperate position, you lose this opportunity.
BITD.RollFailurePositionDesperate: It's the worst outcome. You suffer severe harm, a serious complication occurs, you lose this opportunity for action.
BITD.RollResistance:
You reduce or avoid the effects of the consequence (GM chooses).
Suffer {stress} edges.
BITD.RollResistanceCritical:
You reduce or avoid the effects of the consequence (GM chooses).
Clear 1 edge.
BITD.EffectWarning: Managing Active Effects within an Owned Item is not currently supported by FoundryVTT and will be added in a subsequent update.
BITD.Name: Name
BITD.AcquireAssetExtra: To raise the result beyond critical, you may spend 2 coin per +1 Tier bonus.
BITD.RollViceFailure: You overindulge. Clear {clear_stress} edges and choose one of the following consequences:
BITD.RollViceFailureAttactTrouble: Attract Trouble. Select or roll an additional entanglement.
BITD.RollViceFailureLost: Lost. Your character vanishes for a few weeks. Play a different character until this one returns from their bender. When your character returns, they've also healed any harm they had.
BITD.RollViceFailureTapped: Tapped. Your current purveyor cuts you off. Find a new source for your vice.
BITD.RollFortuneCritical: The result is exceptional. You have great or extreme effect.
BITD.RollFortuneSuccess: The result is good. You have standard or full effect.
BITD.RollFortunePartialSuccess: The result is mixed. You have limited or partial effect.
BITD.RollFortuneFailure: The result is bad. You have poor or little effect.
BITD.RollGatherInformationSuccess: Great: You get exceptional details. The information is complete and follow-up questions may expand into related areas or reveal more than you hoped for.
BITD.RollGatherInformationPartialSuccess: Standard: You get good details. Clarifying and follow-up questions are possible.
BITD.RollGatherInformationFailure: Limited: You get incomplete or partial information. More information gathering will be needed to get all the answers.
BITD.RollEngagementCritical: Exceptional result. You've already overcome the first obstacle and you're in a controlled position for what's next.
BITD.RollEngagementSuccess: Good result. You're in a controlled position when the action starts.
BITD.RollEngagementPartialSuccess: Mixed result. You're in a risky position when the action starts.
BITD.RollEngagementFailure: Bad result. You're in a desperate position when the action starts.
BITD.RollAcquireAssetResult: You gain an asset of Tier {tier_quality} quality.
RITS.SkillsStalkDescription: When you Stalk, you carefully track a target. You might follow a target or discover their location. You might arrange an ambush. You might attack with precision shooting from a distance. You could try to bring your guns to bear in a melee (but Fighting might be better).
RITS.SkillsInterfaceDescription: When you Interface, you connect with cyberspace or harness networked devices. You might execute software or understand aspects of information technology. You could try to go online in order to better understand your situation (but Surveying might be better).
RITS.SkillsSurveyDescription: When you Survey, you observe the situation and anticipate outcomes. You might spot telltale signs of trouble before it happens. You might uncover opportunities or weaknesses. You might detect a person’s motivations or intentions. You could try to spot a good ambush point (but Stalking might be better).
RITS.SkillsEngineerDescription: When you Engineer, you tinker with devices and mechanisms. You might create a new gadget or alter an existing item. You might tinker with a drone, retrofit a vehicle, wire explosives, or sequence (open) a maglock. You might disable an alarm or trap. You might turn the ubiquitous technology in the sprawl to your advantage. You could try to use your technical expertise to disrupt a network (but Interfacing might be better).
RITS.SkillsFinesseDescription: When you Finesse, you employ dexterous manipulation, precise footwork, or subtle misdirection. You might pick someone’s pocket. You might direct a vehicle or control a mount. You might formally duel an opponent with graceful martial arts. You could try to employ those arts in a confusing melee (but Fighting might be better). You could try to pick a lock (but Engineering it might be better).
RITS.SkillsProwlDescription: When you Prowl, you traverse skillfully and quietly. You might scramble past security or leap over barricades. You might drop down from a rooftop or hide in the shadows. You might attack someone from hiding with a back-stab or stun baton. You could try to waylay a victim in the middle of a pitched battle (but Fighting might be better).
RITS.SkillsFightDescription: When you Fight, you entangle a target in close combat so they can’t easily escape. You might brawl or wrestle with them. You might draw a pistol and shove it in someone’s face. You might seize or hold a position in battle. You could engage a martial artist in close combat (but Finessing might be better).
RITS.SkillsWreckDescription: When you Wreck, you unleash savage force or calculated sabotage. You might smash down a door or wall with a sledgehammer, or lob grenades to do the same. You might employ chaos or sabotage to create a distraction or overcome an obstacle. You could try to overwhelm an enemy with sheer force in battle (but Fighting might be better)
RITS.SkillsStudyDescription: When you Study, you scrutinize details and interpret evidence. You might gather information from articles, newscasts, and archived discussion. You might do research on an esoteric topic. You might closely analyze a person to detect lies or true feelings. You could try to examine events to understand a pressing situation (but Surveying might be better).
RITS.SkillsCommandDescription: When you Command, you compel swift obedience with leverage. You might intimidate or threaten to get what you want. You might lead a team in a group action. You could try to order people around to persuade them (but Consorting might be better).
RITS.SkillsConsortDescription: When you Consort, you socialize with friends and contacts. Not necessarily honest. You might gain access to resources, information, people, or places. You might make a good impression or win someone over with your charm and style. You might make new friends or connect with your heritage or background. You could try to manipulate your friends with social pressure (but Influencing might be better).
RITS.SkillsInfluenceDescription: When you Influence, you change attitudes with guile, charm, or argument. Not necessarily dishonest. You might lie convincingly. You might persuade someone to do what you want. You might argue a compelling case that leaves no clear rebuttal. You could try to trick people into affection or obedience (but Consorting or Commanding might be better).
RITS.SkillsAssenseDescription: When you Assense, you open your mind to the astral plane or channel arcane energies through your body. You might communicate with a free spirit or understand aspects of conjuring. You could try to perceive beyond sight (but Surveying might be better).
RITS.SkillsAttuneDescription: When you Attune, you open your mind to the emergent planes or direct nearby electromagnetic signals through your body. You might communicate with a free sprite or understand aspects of technomancy. You could try to perceive beyond sight (but Surveying might be better).
